data.title: Children's Book Author About Page — J.F. Fox / Children's Book Author
data.meta_description: Meet children’s book writer J.F. Fox, author of Friday Night Wrestlefest, who is from Virginia and lives in Brooklyn, New York, and has worked in the children’s book publishing industry as a writer and editor, working with authors and illustrators.
data.text:
HELLO

I’m Jenny. I was born, raised, and educated in southeastern Virginia—that’s the bottom corner of the state that looks like a half-eaten tortilla chip. After college, I moved to New York City. It was a big city and a big change, but I’d wanted to work in children’s books since I was nine, and New York was the place.

Since then, I’ve worked as a children’s book editor, freelance writer, and author, and met tons of creative people along the way. As an editor, I loved working with other authors and illustrators to hone their ideas and craft their stories and art into finished books. After becoming a mom, I decided focus on raising my two sons and working on my own writing.

As a writer, my passion is creating books with a funny, slightly nerdy bent. I love humor, history, introverts, and underdogs, as well as stories for boys that speak to their interests without ignoring their emotions. I also enjoy working with my sons’ school to spread reading joy—organizing author visits, read-a-thons, and used book sales. Most recently I’ve become an advocate for certified school librarians, which are sadly shrinking in numbers. I live with my husband and two sons in Brooklyn and upstate New York.
